Pre-Game Insights: Guyana won all five of their matches in League B last year and finished with a goal difference of +15, second only to Nicaragua's +16.

Guyana went into the match off the back of a 3-1 win over Belize in their last World Cup qualifier in June, which left them third in Group D, three points behind Nicaragua and Panama for a place in the third round.
Guyana have won four of their six Nations League matches at the Synthetic Track Field Facility, including a 3-2 win over the Bahamas in their only match at Leonora last year.

Suriname head into a new Nations League campaign in high spirits on the back of two convincing victories in World Cup qualifying, defeating Saint Vincent and the Grenadines (4-1) and Anguilla (4-0) to sit top of their second-round group.
Since the appointment of Stanley Menzo in March, this side have yet to lose in three matches played across all competitions, outscoring their three opponents by a combined margin of 9-2.

Natio have only suffered one defeat in their previous seven matches played across all competitions, and that 1-0 loss to Cuba on matchday two of the previous Nations League season may have cost them a place in the knockout phase, as they wound up two points below Honduras for a spot in the quarter-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guyana have come from behind to win three of their 2023 matches, with nine of their 15 points coming from defeat.
Suriname have not won an away match against Guyana since June 2008, when they claimed a 2-1 victory in a World Cup qualifying fixture at Providence Stadium.
